name: Yan In Power
description: The long-time ruler of Shanxi, Yan Xishan, has survived machinations from within and without and emerged stronger still. As tensions in China once again begin to rise, Yan must now fully grasp the apparatus of the state and secure the peace his people long for.

name: The Model Governor
description: Yan Xishan, Governor of Shanxi, has kept his province out of war and has made efforts to modernise Shanxi and make it the greatest province in China. For that, Yan Xishan is truly a Model Governor.

name: A Benevolent Dictatorship
description: Yan Xishan may be the de-facto dictator of Shanxi, but he rules with a fair hand. Though he isn't infallible, Yan Xishan uses his talents, capabilities, wisdom, and benevolence to improve Shanxi and make it an island of peace and order.

name: A Progressive State
description: Under Yan Xishan's rule, Shanxi is a rather progressive province, open to reform while others reject it. It shall be kept that way, and Shanxi will be a progressive province that will usher in China's future.

name: With Progressive Customs
description: Traditions, while beneficial and culturally significant, are like shackles that hold Shanxi back, making it stuck in the past. Those traditions must be discarded and replaced with more progressive customs for Shanxi to truly transition into modernity.

name: The First Steps To Modernisation
description: Modernising an entire province is a long and arduous process, but all great journeys must have a humble start. Shanxi will become the province of the future.

name: The Land Reform
description: Land Reform is a universal issue in China and Shanxi is no exception. Land must be redistributed in a fair and equitable way to Shanxi's farmers.

name: New Army Staff
description: Shanxi's army is woefully behind the rest of the world in terms of military innovations and doctrines. New officers, trained in the West, should be promoted to make sure that Shanxi's army doesn't lag behind.

name: The Soldier and His Labour
description: Soldiers must not only stand watch at the borders of the province, they must take an active part in the community in order for Shanxi's workforce to truly be harnessed.

name: The Model Province
description: Shanxi, a modern, progressive and developed province, led by the benevolent hand of Yan Xishan, is China's chief model province in all but name. Shanxi shall continue to be the shining beacon of hope for all of China to follow going into the future.

name: The Model Citizen
description: A true Model Citizen is one who will take up arms to defend his homeland and his country. Shanxi, already led by our Model Governor Yan Xishan, shall surely praise citizens who take up arms to defend their homes and their province, and hold them up as exemplars for the rest to follow.

name: Public Education
description: An educated citizenry is more important than ever in this day and age, as Yan Xishan well knows. Public schools shall be opened for all of Shanxi's children to be educated and thus achieve their full potential.

name: Develop Yan Xishan Thought
description: Yan Xishan has always been pragmatic, willing to embrace various aspects across a range of philosophical traditions to meet his needs, and the needs of Shanxi. With a great ideological war looming on the horizon, Yan must fully flesh out his doctrines, creating a multi-faceted ideology suited to Shanxi's unique situation.

name: Virtue, Knowledge, Welfare
description: The Kuomintang are able to elegantly connect simple ideas to specific concepts relevant to their platform. We must emulate their style of communication.

name: Self-Reflection
description: Confucianism, and Chinese philosophy in general, extol the virtues of self-reflection and thoughtfulness. We must mandate that our high level public servants regularly issue a public report on their conduct and on how they intend to perform more effectively in the future.

name: Follow Tradition
description: While Modernity is good for Shanxi's development, we cannot go into the future without maintaining that which makes us Chinese. Our traditions should be preserved and maintained even as Shanxi moves towards the future.

name: Move With the Times
description: China is woefully behind the West in the development of its political and social norms. We must embrace the necessity of changing our ways, our very being, in the pursuit of modernity. Surely an appeal from Yan himself shall sway the masses to the cause.

name: From the Bottom Up
description: The dignity of the workers must be protected, that much is certain. Since workers' rights have become so intertwined with the growing global ideological conflict, we must tread softly and maintain those principles that the people deserve.

name: From the Top Down
description: A small number of landowners control the vast majority of our province's land. While they are important to the stability of our regime, the people resent them. An equitable solution must be reached.

name: Peaceful Existence
description: Shanxi's neutrality has saved it from the wrath of many ambitious regional powers and allowed it to act as kingmaker in several small conflicts. We must publicly reaffirm our dedication to the policy.

name: Maintain the Edge
description: While we have no desire to start wars ourselves, many warlords in China eye our province hungrily and seek to exploit it for their own goals. We must maintain our edge to protect Shanxi.

name: Fluid Like Water
description: Yan Xishan's ability to combine beneficial elements of many seemingly contradictory ideologies is nothing short of brilliance. Yan Xishan Thought can be adapted to any situation, for it is fluid like water, truly the best ideology to guide Shanxi.

name: Expand the Taiyuan Railway
description: Although Shanxi is underdeveloped, even by Chinese standards, Taiyuan still serves as an important regional rail junction. It shall be the focal point for new construction throughout the region.

name: Prepare Datong Connection
description: Datong was ripped away by the two-faced demons to our east. It shall return to in due time, however, and we must prepare for its integration with our growing rail network.

name: Datong-Yan'an Railway
description: Datong is ours once again, and the prepared expansion of its railways in line with our wider program can begin.

name: Standardise New Railway Gauges
description: Our railway gauges are, on the whole, smaller than those elsewhere in China and the world, causing logistical issues and impeding industrialisation. Furthermore, some regions lack any standardised gauge at all. We should look to convert to a more widely used rail gauge.

name: Increased Imports
description: To fuel our growing economy, the importation of certain consumer goods, as well as those of military importance, should be facilitated and encouraged, freeing up domestic distribution.

name: Resist Opium Imports
description: Opium smuggling has greatly increased due to our reforms. We must end this most despicable practice by force.

name: Expand Railway to Xi'an
description: With the great city of Xi'an under our control, we should link it and the surrounding region to our new rail network.

name: Continue Narrow Railway Gauges
description: While it may inhibit further economic development, we cannot afford to convert our rail gauges. Indeed, it is best that our funding be allocated elsewhere.

name: Military Infrastructure
description: Rather than transport the most closely guarded matériel on civilian railways, the military should have its own limited rail system for secure transport.

name: Rural Industry
description: Shanxi has always been a rural province. While recently efforts have been made to industrialise it, we cannot ignore our rural industry.

name: Agriculture-Dominated Economy
description: As a rural province, Shanxi has a long and storied history of agriculture. Shanxi can maximise its agricultural potential and become an agrarian-dominated economy.

name: Self-Reliance
description: We cannot allow ourselves to depend on foreign powers or other warlords for our sustenance. We must always be able to rely on our own ability to survive and sustain our growth.

name: Urban Development
description: While Shanxi has always been a rather underdeveloped province, cities like Taiyuan continue to develop and grow as continued efforts to industrialise and urbanise start to bear fruit. We should continue these efforts to fully modernise Shanxi.

name: Farm Cooperation
description: While it is sometimes difficult to trust your fellow countrymen in such a tumultuous country as China, we cannot truly prosper unless we band together as a Chinese community. We should start cooperating with other regional powers in order to improve our agricultural potential.

name: Expand the Taiyuan Arsenal
description: In China, you must always be prepared for war, and one of the requirements is to always have arms and ammunition at our disposal. An Arsenal to house weapons should be constructed in Taiyuan to make sure that we're ready when we're ever invaded.

name: Ban the Opium Trade
description: Opium, the addictive substance introduced by western imperialists to subdue China, is an evil and dangerous drug that has poisoned China for decades. We must ban all opium trade in order to curb opium addiction in our province.

name: Alternative Crops
description: In addition to banning opium, we should also incentivise farmers in Shanxi to grow other crops, such as a variety of staple foods that can feed our citizens and our soldiers.

name: Fund the Modernisation
description: Modernisation is an expensive process, but as we've seen in the west, it will bear fruit given enough investment. We must do the same by funding modernisation efforts across the province to carry us into the future.

name: Cleanse Corruption
description: Corruption is endemic in Shanxi, and it is no secret. To ensure our continued development as a modernising province, corrupt bosses in several factories and organisations should be rooted out and removed.

name: Improve Provincial Roads
description: Shanxi, a comparatively underdeveloped province, needs to improve its infrastructure and roads to better modernise. More roads should be built in a network connecting important parts of the province together.

name: Industrial Funding
description: Large factories are required if a modern province is to develop itself. Building large industrial complexes to ensure constant production of goods will certainly benefit Shanxi.

name: Expand Coal Mining
description: Coal is an essential part of our economy. We should expand our own mining operations across Shanxi to better harness the resource and enrich ourselves as a province, and thus reduce our reliance on foreign corporations and their equipment.

name: Invest in Shanxi Companies
description: Local companies are the key to our success as a modernising province. We should help them grow and become influential in the Chinese market.

name: Competing in the Chinese Market
description: China has massive economic potential and it is ripe for competition. Shanxi can become a leading province if its companies manage to beat their competitors. We shall invest these companies to help them out-compete other Chinese regions and corner the broader market for ourselves.

name: Modern Manufacturing Techniques
description: China has studied the west for years now, and one of the most important lessons is western manufacturing techniques. We should replicate these techniques in order to make our own factories more efficient.

name: Improve Metal Refineries
description: We should improve our smelting methods so we can refine our metals for a variety of purposes both military and civilian.

name: Purchase New Designs
description: We are not satisfied with old and obsolete equipment. We should purchase new designs that we can then replicate in our own factories.

name: Continue the Modernisation
description: With unprecedented effort put into modernising Shanxi, we're surely on track to become a fully modernised province. We should maintain those efforts to make sure that we fully modernise and adapt to the 20th century.

name: Our Recruitment Problem
description: Shanxi's small size and small population have made recruitment exceedingly difficult. We must make a big recruiting drive to alleviate that problem.

name: Small Arms Research
description: Western arms are always highly sought after in China, and Shanxi is no exception. New contracts will be negotiated to ensure that our military is equipped for whatever it may face.

name: Stability of a Model Province
description: Shanxi is one of the most stable provinces in China. We should promote our governmental model for China to follow.

name: Help Those in Need
description: A large contributing factor of our improved stability is our ability and willingness to aid the poor and those in need, and indeed we shall continue doing so.

name: Arm the Troops
description: Of course, an army without weapons is merely an unarmed mob. We need to give our soldiers proper weapons so they can fight as a modern army.

name: German Arms Imports
description: Germany is a major international supplier of armaments. Perhaps we should ask them to give us some of their guns?

name: Rural Investments
description: We should invest in our rural areas so they can aid us more in the future.

name: Learn from Japanese Efficiency
description: The Japanese are known for their efficiency amongst the Asian nations, and everyone is taking notice. We must not lag behind; we should study Japanese methods to maximise our own efficiency.

name: Russian Arms Imports
description: As Russia has a land connection to China, we could ask them to give us some of their weapons.

name: Rural Military Academies
description: We should create new military academies open to the rural population, so as to not miss the next Jade General simply because he wasn't born to privileged parents.

name: Yan'an Military Arsenal
description: While Taiyuan has its own military arsenal, Yan'an, on the other side of Shanxi, should have a sizeable arsenal as well.

name: Mass Rural Recruitment
description: Farmers and ranchers are not exempt from being drafted into the army, and we should emphasize that. Everyone must be able to fight for Shanxi.

name: Military Mines
description: The army should be able to access mines as well, to be able to harness Shanxi's resources for its advantage.

name: Hire Former Bandits
description: While this could be a controversial decision, we must recruit everyone we can, including former bandits. Perhaps an army life will wash away their old habits and help Shanxi in the long run.

name: Fill the Factories
description: We should fill the factories with soldiers. A soldier can help Shanxi in the assembly line as well as on the front line.

name: Raise Small Militias
description: Small village militias are very important when dealing with bandits and raiders. They can also be helpful when fighting invaders. Every village should have its own militia.

name: Emergency Conscription
description: With war upon us, we require substantially more men for our armed forces. We must broaden our conscription policy.

name: Inspirational Leadership
description: Morale is a crucial aspect of modern warfare. We should give our soldiers a just cause for which to fight: fight for their families, fight for their homes, fight for Shanxi!

name: Taiyuan General Staff
description: The current command structure of Shanxi's army is decentralised at best and dysfunctional at worst. We should form a General Staff to coordinate military efforts in a more cohesive manner.

name: Artillery Developments
description: Artillery has won many battles in China. We should develop our own artillery to match the abilities of other warlords.

name: Warlord Tactics
description: We should study the tactics used by Wu Peifu, Zhang Zuolin, and the other warlords to learn their strategies and be able to use this knowledge against them.

name: Inspiration from Dare-to-Die Corps
description: We should inspire our very own Dare-to-Die Corps, as not only should brave men be willing to sacrifice for China, but for Shanxi!

name: Support Companies
description: Support companies for our brigades are crucial to ensure victory in a variety of situations. We shall invest in improving our support battalions.

name: Reward Military Innovation
description: Innovations in military tactics and armaments should be rewarded. If our generals can develop cunning plans and inspire their troops, then no enemy will stand before us.

name: Taiyuan Redoubt
description: Taiyuan should be made into an impenetrable citadel to ensure Shanxi's safety. Artillery emplacements, bunkers, defensive positions, and all stratagems shall be considered.

name: Radio Companies
description: Wireless communications technology via radio signals has finally developed into a compact enough form to be used for our military purposes. We should use it to facilitate rapid communications between our high command and various radio companies in the field.

name: Central Leadership
description: A strong and decisive central leadership is crucial for military cohesion. Reorganising the chain of command to be more centralised would greatly improve our military effectiveness.

name: Innovative Artillery Research
description: More artillery research is required to edge out warlords across China, and to ensure that our armies have superior firepower.

name: New Officer Schools
description: Young officers should be trained in academies to become able field commanders that will lead Shanxi to military victories in the future.

name: Rifle Development
description: Acquiring and developing more advanced rifles is absolutely necessary for military success. A centralised and cohesive leadership cannot be truly effective if our soldiers have obsolete equipment.

name: Military Science
description: We should delve into military science to look into how it can be used to better hone Shanxi's ability to fight and win wars.
